text: I remember when I first laid my hands on this game. I was in 6th grade and just recently got on the A, B honor roll for the first time in ever. My parents proudly paraded me up to toys r us and bought me the copy of any game I wanted, I picked this one. Oh, nostalgia how I never tire of you.
author: DestinLe

text:
lol

well the game was back in the Super Nes days. Plus it's the first Mario RPG that was released. I wonder how many Mario fans wondered if the game would turn out well?

Geno, Mallow and having Bowser on your team along with Toadstool???? Who Would've thought?

So being a completely new and fresh game, it's understandable the way they did the who battle mechanics. 

But I'm not going to get nit picky on it. I'm already pissed at SE and how they won't go back to the roots of their FF franchise
author: The Destati

text:

author: AlliroG98

text: All Mario games are in that genre. And I'm perfectly find by it. As I stated earlier in my comments, the beautiful thing about Mario games is that they're not given to: violence, promiscuous sexuality nor coarse language usage. Yet look how well they still are. I can play Mario games with all ages. Not just adults but also with kids and not have to worry about them covering their eyes or ears. And the composer(s) for those Mario games are amazing! I'll take childish Mario games over saints row
author: The Destati

text: But it's more childish than other Mario RPGs.
author: AlliroG98

text:
I own it!

very fun game. very different (at least back when it came out) Nintendo did a great job in developing that game. Very original and fresh. 

My favorite part (and music) of that game was Crystal Crawl Palace. It's very eerie. The setting of that music was almost perfect. I wish they brought back that composer who did Paper Mario since I thought he did a great job

Truly a Rare Gem

author: HammerMagic

text: Ah, SMRPG... hardly forgettable, one of the late SNES classics and a grand partnership between Square and Nintendo.  Beautiful in every way, I know why it was so hard to whittle it down to 10 minutes of music - EVERY DAMN TUNE in the game is worthy of this list!  Serious (Mallow Finds Out That He Is Not A Tadpole), absurd (Margarie Margarita), fun (Booster Hill), or just plain charming (Marrymore), Shimorura Yoko did a superb job on the soundtrack.
author: browncoatkevin

text:
It was shitty on the Nintendo standard. Nintendo directors and producers said themselves they were disappointed in Sunlight, Twilight Princess, and none of the zeldas to date have surpassed Ocarina. The current Zelda director won't retire until he surpasses OOT.

I don't know about you, but when the own game designers and general opinion of the gaming industry reviewers agree on the same page - I SORTA have a point. JUST SORTA....
author: magicalpoop

text: stop assing around, people, and enjoy the music.
author: Nic De Houwer

text: Hate to break it to ya but Mario 64 by your definition is also a gimick as well. They had to throw out a lot of the original things that made Mario who he was. They did the same with every game between Super Mario World and SMRPG. As such I still see your opinion as shallow since Nintendo has always experimented with mario in order to build up his identity. I think nintendo wanted to establish the fact he's the most normal of all their creations, thus allowing fans to identify with him more.
author: NUTCASE71733

text:
It is a gimmick when it's popular opinion in this gaming industry. Sunshine ultilized the fludd system and tried to add a new dimension to Mario, however dumbing down many of the core aspects of the game - what most mario (And mario 64) was famous for. Your argumentation is poor at best, to say the least. Of course they never stated it was supposed to be ground breaking or new adaptions to the series , but it's a rather obvious attempt.
Don't give me that asinine attitude.
author: magicalpoop

text: They never said they "Branched out" with Windwaker. They simply tried a new graphic style that added more emotion than the previous games. I hardlyy call it a gimick. Same with Sunshine. It was just a new game, it never stated a ground breaking adaptation to the series. As such your logic falls flat on it's face. I'm sorry, but that's the truth.
author: NUTCASE71733

text: funny, that doesn't really direct to Zelda now does it? Ocarina of time is like link to the past but on steroids. Yeah the cel shaded sea adventure was a nice try but a fail at that. Nintendo just inserts a random gimmick and attempts to sway gamers into thinking its a ground breaking revolution in the franchise.
author: magicalpoop

text: Mario paint was badass though.  You misread my comment. I never said Nintendo whored him out,etc. Just lashed them for making shitty iterations like Mario Sunshine and whatnot. Now they seem to just rehash mario/zelda and don't even try branching out lke what you said.
author: magicalpoop

text: I hardly call branching out "whoring". If you think that, you shouldn't be a gamer. Any self-respecting gamer and/or Mario fan would know that this was the only way Mario could have survived during the Console War era. Sonic offered gamers a new way to play, and Mario had to do the same to keep the fanbase.
author: NUTCASE71733

text: If Nintendo had done nothing but stay with all the old stuff, he would have gotten old very fast. Why else do you think his focus changed when Sonic came up? Nintendo had to mix it up to keep him in the competition.
author: NUTCASE71733

text:
Back in the day there were Mario EDUCATIONAL GAMES

Stop fooling yourself, Nintendo always has been whoring Mario out
author: Doom2Guy

text: ah a blast from the past..from the days of Nintendo's glory days..when they cared about making traditional video games (yes I realize this was made by SquareSOFT) But my point is Nintendo is just as bad or worse than Microsoft, so obsessed with $ , they dont care how they get it. Twilight Princess was disappointing and to make things worse they tacked on the cheesy Wii controls. Any diehard Zelda fan will agree with me on this one. Mario Galaxy...it was good but...missing something..
